etymologies: early 19th century: modern Latin, from Greek, from paranoos ‘distracted’, from para ‘irregular’ + noos ‘mind’

definitions: a mental condition characterized by delusions of persecution, unwarranted jealousy, or exaggerated self-importance, typically elaborated into an organized system. It may be an aspect of chronic personality disorder, of drug abuse, or of a serious condition such as schizophrenia in which the person loses touch with reality.
shortDefinitions: mental condition characterized by delusions of persecution

definitions: suspicion and mistrust of people or their actions without evidence or justification

examples.text: the global paranoia about hackers and viruses

shortDefinitions: unjustified suspicion and mistrust of other people
